items.finding: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of [STATE_1] without regard to its conflict of laws provisions. Any judicial proceeding shall be initiated in [CITY_1]. The parties waive inconvenient forum as a defense to said action and consent to exclusive jurisdiction in [STATE_1].
Each party agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold the other harmless from claims, liabilities, or damages resulting from their negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of any SOW or this Agreement.
Aggregate liability of either party shall be limited to the total compensation received under the applicable SOW.

Upon termination, [COMPANY_A] shall be paid for all Services performed and reimbursable expenses incurred up to the termination date. Any unused funds paid in advance shall be refunded to the Customer within thirty (30) days of termination, where applicable. Termination will not relieve either Party of obligations that, by their nature, survive termination, including confidentiality, indemnification, and payment for work performed.

Written notice will be provided before work is halted. Work will resume upon resolution of the issue(s) and will result in revised project timelines. [COMPANY_A] will not be liable for any delays or damages resulting from such suspension.
Indemnification obligations do not extend to consequential damages unless expressly agreed upon in writing.
To the maximum extent permitted by law, neither party shall be liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages.

Unless otherwise stated below, [COMPANY_A] retains ownership and intellectual property rights in deliverables created under this MSA or any SOW, including custom intellectual property (IP) development, proprietary toolsets, and custom workflow configurations specifically designed for the Customer. These deliverables are considered instruments of service, and [COMPANY_A] retains all rights, including copyright and re-use rights, provided the Customer retains ownership of Customer’s original desig

Either party may terminate this Agreement or any SOW immediately if the other party breaches a material provision of this Agreement and fails to cure the breach within thirty (30) days of written notice. Examples of material breaches include, but are not limited to:

This Master Service Agreement will remain in effect for an initial term of two (2) years from the Effective Date and will automatically renew for successive one-year periods unless either party provides written notice of intent to terminate at least 30 days prior to the renewal date.

[COMPANY_A] will retain project-related data for a period of thirty (30) days following the completion or termination of the applicable SOW, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing. The Customer is responsible for maintaining backups of deliverables after project completion.
This Master Service Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of 08 / 21 / 2025 ("Effective Date") by and between:
[COMPANY_A], a corporation organized and existing under the laws of [STATE_1] with its principal office located at [ADDRESS_A] ("[COMPANY_A]"); and

[COMPANY_B], a Conveyor Systems Engineer organized and existing under the laws of [STATE_2], with its principal office located at [ADDRESS_B] ("Customer") each a “Party” and both “Parties” to this Agreement

[COMPANY_A] agrees to provide professional services ("Services") as described in individual Statements of Work ("SOW"), which shall be issued separately under this MSA. Each SOW will specify in detail:
Project phases and deliverables: A breakdown of milestones, timelines, and measurable outcomes.
Additionally, any assumptions, constraints, and requirements specific to a project will be outlined in the relevant SOW. Each SOW shall be governed by the terms of this MSA.
[COMPANY_A] shall charge interest, and Customer shall pay, at the rate of seventeen percent (17%) per annum on all unpaid balances over thirty (30) days old.

The Customer’s professional personnel shall be responsible for stamping the work, shall have exclusive responsibility for reviewing all work, and shall bear full accountability for all aspects of the design.
Failure to meet these responsibilities may result in project delays and potential additional costs, as outlined in the applicable SOW.
In the absence of written objections within the specified timeframe, the deliverables shall be deemed accepted.

If [COMPANY_A] agrees to a longer data retention period, we shall not be liable for ensuring the usability or integrity of the retained data, nor shall we be held responsible for any data loss or inaccessibility resulting from cybersecurity incidents, such as encryption or ransomware attacks.
Customer acknowledges that failure to provide notice to proceed in a timely manner may result in substantial changes to project timelines.
[COMPANY_A] is not the engineer, surveyor, or architect of record and assumes no responsibility as such for all aspects of the project. The Customer’s licensed professional will:
[COMPANY_A] will provide modeling and documentation support under the guidance of the Customer. Any deviations from thescope of work must be approved in writing.
[COMPANY_A] is an independent contractor and not an employee or agent of the Customer. Nothing in this Agreement shall create a joint venture or partnership.
All notices shall be in writing and sent to the addresses specified above via certified mail, courier, or email with confirmation of receipt.
